activity_id:
IMMZ.C4.Create client record
OR

description_and_definition: Unique identifier for the client, according to the policies applicable to each country. There can be more than one unique identifier used to link records (e.g. national ID, health ID, immunization information system ID, medical record ID)
validation_condition: Minimum and maximum number of characters based on local policy

activity_id:
IMMZ.C4.Create client record
OR
IMMZ.C5.3.Update client details
description_and_definition: The full name of the client
validation_condition: Only letters and special characters (period, dash) allowed.
loinc_version_268comments__consideration: Long common name: Patient name

activity_id:
IMMZ.C4.Create client record
OR
IMMZ.C5.3.Update client details

validation_condition: Only letters and special characters (period, dash) allowed.

IMMZ.C4.Create client record
OR
IMMZ.C5.3.Update client details
description_and_definition: Client's family name or last name
validation_condition: Only letters and special characters (period, dash) allowed.
loinc_version_268comments__consideration: Long common name: Last name

IMMZ.C4.Create client record
OR
IMMZ.C5.3.Update client details

activity_id:
IMMZ.C4.Create client record
OR
IMMZ.C5.3.Update client details
description_and_definition: Client's date of birth (DOB) if known; if unknown, use assigned DOB for administrative purposes
validation_condition: Date ≤ Current Date
notes: If date of birth is unknown, estimated DOB can be provided or estimated age can be used to estimate DOB
loinc_version_268comments__consideration: Long common name: Birth date
snomed_gps_comments_considerations: Code title: Date of birth (observable entity)

activity_id:
IMMZ.C4.Create client record
OR
IMMZ.C5.3.Update client details
description_and_definition: The client's calculated age (presented as number of years, months, days) based on the date of birth (DOB) and the visit date
validation_condition: Years, Months, Days
explain_conditionality: Required if input in IMMZ.C.DE10 Date of birth is entered
loinc_version_268comments__consideration: Long common name: Current age or age at death

activity_id:
IMMZ.C4.Create client record
OR
IMMZ.C5.3.Update client details
description_and_definition: The client's caregiver (person) which could be next of kin (e.g. partner, husband, mother, sibling, etc.)

activity_id:
IMMZ.C4.Create client record
OR
IMMZ.C5.3.Update client details
description_and_definition: The full name of the client's caregiver
validation_condition: Only letters and special characters (period, dash) allowed

activity_id:
IMMZ.C4.Create client record
OR
IMMZ.C5.3.Update client details
description_and_definition: First or given name of the client's caregiver
validation_condition: Only letters and special characters (period, dash) allowed

activity_id:
IMMZ.C4.Create client record
OR
IMMZ.C5.3.Update client details

validation_condition: Only letters and special characters (period, dash) allowed

activity_id:
IMMZ.C4.Create client record
OR
IMMZ.C5.3.Update client details
description_and_definition: Client's phone number; can be a landline or a mobile phone number
loinc_version_268comments__consideration: Long common name: Patient Phone number
snomed_gps_comments_considerations: Code title: Patient telephone number (observable entity)

activity_id:
IMMZ.C4.Create client record
OR
IMMZ.C5.3.Update client details
description_and_definition: The name of the city/municipality/town/village of where the client lives
input_options: Context-specific list of administrative areas e.g. Vaccination location list, District list, etc.
validation_condition: Should be selected from list of local administrative areas
notes: Should be list of local areas, or potentially a string fill in field. List of Local areas is recommended since it will prevent data entry errors.
loinc_version_268comments__consideration: Long common name: Address

activity_id:
IMMZ.C4.Create client record
OR
IMMZ.C5.3.Update client details
description_and_definition: Is the client an active and participating health worker. This data element is used mainly for reporting and indicators purposes
explain_conditionality: Required if input in IMMZ.C.DE13 Age > 15 years
notes: A list of healthcare worker roles is available in the FHIR Practitioner Role valueset: https://build.fhir.org/valueset-practitioner-role.html

description_and_definition: Indicates if the client has received a birth dose and/or a zero dose

Indicates if the client has completed the primary vaccination series of a product/antigen. If the client has not yet completed their primary series, it means they may be expected to receive more doses to complete their vaccination regimen for the respective product/antigen.

data_element_label: Date when primary vaccination series was completed
description_and_definition: The date when the client completed the primary vaccination series (per product/antigen)
validation_condition: Date ≤ Current Date
explain_conditionality: Required if input in IMMZ.D1.DE8 Completed the primary vaccination series is Yes

description_and_definition: The current human immunodeficiency virus (HIV) status of the client
loinc_version_268comments__consideration: HIV Status

description_and_definition: The client is known to be HIV positive
icd11comments__considerations: Code title: Human immunodeficiency virus disease without mention of associated disease or condition, clinical stage unspecified
icd10comments__considerations: Code title: Asymptomatic HIV infection status
loinc_version_268comments__consideration: Code title: HIV infection [Minimum Data Set]
snomed_gps_comments_considerations: Code title: Human immunodeficiency virus positive

description_and_definition: The client is known to be HIV negative
icd11comments__considerations: Code title: Medical observation or evaluation for other suspected diseases or conditions, ruled out
icd10comments__considerations: Code title: Observation for other suspected diseases and conditions
loinc_version_268comments__consideration: Code title: HIV infection [Minimum Data Set]

description_and_definition: The client's HIV status is unknown
The infant was preterm; the mother gave birth to the infant when gestational age was less than 37 weeks
explain_conditionality: Required in input in IMMZ.C.DE13 Age is < 1 month
icd11comments__considerations: Code title: Preterm newborn
icd10comments__considerations: Code title: Other preterm infants
loinc_version_268comments__consideration: Code title: Premature infant

description_and_definition: The client is known to be severely immunosuppressed
explain_conditionality: Required if input in IMMZ.D.DE19 vaccine type is Measles vaccines
loinc_version_268comments__consideration: Code title: Immune status

description_and_definition: The date on which the client started or restarted antiretroviral therapy (ART)
validation_condition: Date ≤ Current Date
explain_conditionality: Required if input in IMMZ.D.DE19 vaccine type is Measles vaccines
notes: Compatible with HL7 FHIR date https://www.hl7.org/fhir/datatypes.html#date (e.g. YYYY-MM-DD)

description_and_definition: The current status or recommendation for a specific immunization for an client
notes: The system can automatically set at value for this data element based on the outputs of the decision logic tables run as part of activity "IMMZ.D2 Determine required vaccinations"

description_and_definition: The client is not currently eligible or scheduled for the specified immunization
The client is currently eligible and should receive the specified immunization based on the recommended schedule
icd11comments__considerations: Code title: Underimmunization status
icd10comments__considerations: Code title: Underimmunization status

description_and_definition: The client has received the specified immunization(s) based on the recommended schedule
The specified immunization is not recommended for the client due to contraindications
icd11comments__considerations: Code title: Immunization not carried out for unspecified reason
icd10comments__considerations: Code title: Immunization not carried out for unspecified reason

description_and_definition: Additional assessment is necessary before making a recommendation regarding the specified immunization
notes: This data element is an action to be performed by the health worker

description_and_definition: Specific situations or medical conditions in which it is advised or recommended to avoid or delay administering a particular vaccine
The client is currently pregnant
notes: If the client cannot be determined to be reasonably pregnant/not pregnant, it is recommended that a pregnancy test be used to determine whether or not the client is pregnant before administering certain vaccines that should not be given to pregnant individuals.
icd11comments__considerations: Code title: Pregnant state
icd10comments__considerations: Code title: Pregnant state, incidental
loinc_version_268comments__consideration: Code title: Pregnancy Status

description_and_definition: The client is known to be severely immunocompromised or immunosuppressed
icd11comments__considerations: Code title: Diseases of the immune system, unspecified
icd10comments__considerations: Code title: Disorder involving the immune mechanism, unspecified
loinc_version_268comments__consideration: Code title: Immune status

description_and_definition: The client is known to have history of anaphylaxis in the past. Anaphylaxis is a severe and potentially life-threatening allergic reaction that can occur rapidly after exposure to an allergen or vaccine component.
icd11comments__considerations: Code title: Personal history of anaphylaxis
icd10comments__considerations: Code title: Personal history of anaphylaxis

description_and_definition: The client is known to have severe allergic reaction to vaccine
icd11comments__considerations: Code title: Personal history of allergy to drugs, medicaments or biological substances
icd10comments__considerations: Code title: Personal history of allergy to drugs, medicaments and biological substances

description_and_definition: The client is experiencing HIV-related symptoms
icd11comments__considerations: Code title: HIV disease clinical stage 2 without mention of tuberculosis or malaria
icd10comments__considerations: Code title: Human immunodeficiency virus [HIV] disease
loinc_version_268comments__consideration: Code title: Symptom, diagnosis, or opportunistic infection related to HIV treatment
snomed_gps_comments_considerations: Code title: Human immunodeficiency virus infection

description_and_definition: The current status of the individual immunization event
The immunization event was successfully carried out as intended

Immunization event record has been mistakenly created or entered into system. Recorded information is incorrect or should not have been documented, though it is possible that real-world decisions were based on it
Planned immunization event was not carried out for some reason
The reason this immunization event was not performed
explain_conditionality: Required if input in IMMZ.D.DE1 Immunization event status is Not Done
icd11comments__considerations: Code title: Immunization not carried out
icd10comments__considerations: See subcategory content below

description_and_definition: Testing has shown that the client already has immunity to the agent targeted by the immunization
icd11comments__considerations:
Code title: Immunization not carried out for other reasons

Index term under .Y
icd10comments__considerations: Code title: Immunization Not carried out for other reasons

description_and_definition: The client currently has a medical condition for which the vaccine is contraindicated or for which precaution is warranted
icd11comments__considerations:
Code title: Immunization not carried out for other reasons

Index term under .Y
icd10comments__considerations: Code title: Immunization Not carried out for other reasons

description_and_definition: There was no supply of the product on hand to perform the service
icd11comments__considerations: Code title: Immunization not carried out due to lack of availability
icd10comments__considerations: Code title: Immunization Not carried out for other reasons

description_and_definition: The client or their guardian objects to receiving the vaccine
icd11comments__considerations: Code title: Immunization not carried out because of patient refusal
icd10comments__considerations: Code title: Immunization not carried out because of patient's decision for other and unspecified reasons
snomed_gps_comments_considerations: Code title: Vaccine refused by patient (situation)

description_and_definition: The client's caregiver refused the vaccine
icd11comments__considerations: Code title: Immunization not carried out because of caregiver refusal
icd10comments__considerations: Code title: Immunization Not carried out for other reasons

description_and_definition: The immunization event was not carried out for an unspecified reason
icd11comments__considerations: Code title: Immunization not carried out for unspecified reason
icd10comments__considerations: Code title: Immunization not carried out for unspecified reason

data_element_label: Client allergy to vaccine or component
description_and_definition: The immunization event was not carried out because of client allergy to vaccine or component
input_options: Client allergy to vaccine or component
icd11comments__considerations: Code title: Immunization not carried out because of patient allergy to vaccine or component
icd10comments__considerations: Code title: Immunization not carried out because of contraindication

description_and_definition: The immunization event was not carried out because the client is immunocompromised
icd11comments__considerations: Code title: Immunization not carried out because of immune-compromised state of patient
icd10comments__considerations: Code title: Immunization not carried out because of contraindication

description_and_definition: The immunization event was not carried out due a chronic illness or condition of the client
icd11comments__considerations: Code title: Immunization not carried out because of chronic illness or condition of patient
icd10comments__considerations: Code title: Immunization not carried out because of contraindication

description_and_definition: The immunization event was not carried out due to an acute illness present in the client
icd11comments__considerations: Code title: Immunization not carried out because of acute illness
icd10comments__considerations: Code title: Immunization not carried out because of contraindication

description_and_definition: The immunization event was not carried out due to the client having had the disease
icd11comments__considerations: Code title: Immunization not carried out due to patient having had the disease
icd10comments__considerations: Code title: Immunization not carried out because of contraindication

data_element_label: Immunization not carried out for other reasons
description_and_definition: The immunization event was not carried out for other reasons
input_options: Immunization not carried out for other reasons
icd11comments__considerations: Code title: Immunization not carried out for other reasons
icd10comments__considerations: Code title: Immunization not carried out because of patient's decision for reasons of belief or group pressure

description_and_definition: The brand or trade name used to refer to the vaccine received
notes: This data element can be predetermined by a vaccine product registry. If vaccine registry is unavailable, we can capture this as a string.

description_and_definition: Uses a living but weakened version of the virus or one thats very similar
notes: This data element is a vaccine attribute

activity_id:
IMMZ.D1.Capture client history
OR
IMMZ.D13.Update client record
description_and_definition: Vaccine type/category that was administered or was to be administered. Any vaccine code available in the IMMZ.Z Vaccine Library list of codes applies in this data element
input_options: As defined in IMMZ.Z Vaccine Library
notes: A product code from the list of codes defined in the vaccine library can be used here.
loinc_version_268comments__consideration: Long common name: Vaccine code (CPT) CPHS

activity_id:
IMMZ.D1.Capture client history
OR
IMMZ.D13.Update client record
description_and_definition: Represents the visit/encounter date, which is the date and time when the vaccine was administered to the client
validation_condition: Must be a date and time value
linkages_to_aggregate_indicators: IMMZ.IND.01-24, IMMZ.IND.29, IMMZ.IND.31, IMMZ.IND.33, IMMZ.IND.35, IMMZ.IND.37-39
notes: Compatible with HL7 FHIR dateTime https://www.hl7.org/fhir/datatypes.html#dateTime (e.g. YYYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ss+zz:zz)
loinc_version_268comments__consideration: Long common name: Date and time of vaccination

description_and_definition: The service delivery country where the vaccine administration occurred
validation_condition: ISO 3166-1 alpha-3 (or numeric)
notes: ISO 3166-1 alpha-3 (or numeric)

description_and_definition: The service delivery location where the vaccine administration occurred
notes: This data element can also be predetermined by a Member State's health facility registry.
loinc_version_268comments__consideration: Long common name: Where was vaccine received

description_and_definition: The manufacturer of the vaccine product
notes: This data element can be predetermined by a vaccine product registry. If vaccine registry is unavailable, can be captured as a string.
loinc_version_268comments__consideration: Long common name: Manufacturer name [Identifier] Vaccine

description_and_definition: Batch number or lot number of vaccine
loinc_version_268comments__consideration: Long common name: Lot number [Identifier] Vaccine

description_and_definition: Name of the market authorization holder of the vaccine received. If market authorization holder is unknown, vaccine manufacturer is REQUIRED
notes: This data element can be predetermined by a vaccine product registry. If vaccine registry is unavailable, can be captured as a string.

description_and_definition: The expiration date of the vaccine
loinc_version_268comments__consideration: Long common name: Expiration Date of Medication [AHRQ]

description_and_definition: The quantity of vaccine product that was administered
validation_condition: Must be positive decimal value greater than zero (>0.00)
loinc_version_268comments__consideration: Long common name: Doses of vaccine given [#]--per symptom onset

description_and_definition: The person, organization, or role of the entity that performed the act of giving the vaccine to the client. The implementing system can choose to populate this field using data from a health worker registry or health facility registry
validation_condition: Minimum and maximum number of characters based on local policy
notes: This field could be a reference to the Practitioner record

activity_id:
IMMZ.D1.Capture client history
 OR
 IMMZ.D13.Update client record
description_and_definition: Vaccine dose number including dose number within series
validation_condition: Must be an integer greater than or equal to zero (>=0)
linkages_to_aggregate_indicators: IMMZ.IND.03, IMMZ.IND.13-15, IMMZ.IND.17-24, IMMZ.IND.33, IMMZ.IND.35, IMMZ.IND.37, IMMZ.IND.39
notes: This field can also be calculated as defined by member states

description_and_definition: The recommended number of doses for immunity according to the national protocol
validation_condition: Must be positive integer greater than zero (>0)
notes: This data element can also be predetermined by a vaccine product registry.

description_and_definition: Vaccine preventable disease being targeted
The vaccine preventable disease being targeted is measles
icd11comments__considerations: Code title: Measles
icd10comments__considerations: Code title: Measles

description_and_definition: Date on which the next vaccination should be administered, if a next dose is required
notes: Compatible with HL7 FHIR date https://www.hl7.org/fhir/datatypes.html#date (e.g. YYYY-MM-DD)

description_and_definition: Date the patient is to return for next vaccination
Date when follow-up is recommended based on vaccination schedule
loinc_version_268comments__consideration: Code LongName: Follow-up (referred to) provider /specialist, appointment date CPHS

description_and_definition: Indicates if a digital certificate is required
The authority or authorized organization that issued the vaccination certificate
explain_conditionality: Required if input in IMMZ.D.DE151 Digital certificate needed is Yes

description_and_definition: Unique identifier used to associate the immunization event represented in a paper vaccination card to its digital representation(s)
explain_conditionality: Required if input in IMMZ.D.DE151 Digital certificate needed is Yes

description_and_definition: Date in which the certificate for an immunization event became valid.  No health or clinical inferences should be made from this date
explain_conditionality: Required if input in IMMZ.D.DE151 Digital certificate needed is Yes
notes:
Compatible with HL7 FHIR dateTime with time zone specified
https://www.hl7.org/fhir/datatypes.html#dateTime

description_and_definition: Last date in which the certificate for an immunization event is valid. No health or clinical inferences should be made from this date
explain_conditionality: Required if input in IMMZ.D.DE151 Digital certificate needed is Yes
notes:
Compatible with HL7 FHIR dateTime with time zone specified
https://www.hl7.org/fhir/datatypes.html#dateTime

description_and_definition: Version of the core data set and HL7 Fast Health Interoperability Resrouces (FHIR) Implementation Guide that the certificate is using
explain_conditionality: Required if input in IMMZ.D.DE151 Digital certificate needed is Yes

description_and_definition: Location (vaccination location or place) for which the data in the report is being represented
validation_condition: Minimum and maximum number of characters based on local policy

description_and_definition: The start date of the reporting period for which data in the report has been included
validation_condition: Must be a date value

description_and_definition: The end date of the reporting period for which data in the report has been included
validation_condition: Must be a date value

description_and_definition: Indicates the overall strata or disaggregation which is being represented in the report (e.g. by gender, by region, by age group, etc.)
A disaggregation grouped by the indicator population's sex values
A disaggregation grouped by the indicator population's administrative regions/ areas
A disaggregation grouped by the indicator population's age groups
A disaggregation grouped by the indicator population's dose numbers for a specific vaccine
A disaggregation grouped by the indicator population's vaccine types
A disaggregation grouped by the indicator population's vaccine manufacturers for a specific vaccine
A disaggregation grouped by the indicator population's reaction manifestations for a specific vaccine
A disaggregation grouped by the indicator population's type of reaction for a specific vaccine
